refnamediv.refpurpose: Synchronize centralds. Gurantee smooth operations if one of the centralds is switched to off, etc..

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: &dhpackage; is designed to keep multiple centralds synchronized. It shall be added as a required part of the setup. The &dhpackage; set weather on all connected systems to bad if any of the situations described bellow is detected.

If at least of of the centralds is switched to HARD OFF state. This gurantee that if observer switch one centrald on a site to HARD OFF, the other domes on site will not open. The HARD OFF state is so designed - to inform system that the observer intentions are to not run any telescope on site.

If at least one of the connections to the centrald is broken. This gurantee that if one of the centrald is not running, system will not switch to state which will allow it to open the roofs. This is to prevent situation, when one centrald will be switched to HARD OFF, then the centrald on which system was switched to HARD OFF and the other systems, lacking any weather blocks, will open.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: This program follows the usual &gnu; command line syntax, with long options starting with two dashes (`--'). A summary of options is included below.

listitem.para: Specify port of on which &dhpackage; listen for incoming connections. The default value is choosen from available system ports. If you have any reason to provide a fixed port to listen for connections, please specify it here.

Specify name of the host and possibly port, which runs rts2-centrald1. This option is needed only for setups that use multiple computers. Its default is localhost for hostname and 617 for port number. If only hostname is provided, default port number - 617 - is used. Default will work for simple setups.
